briefdescription.para: Initialize a global vector with a parallel manager.
Move the object to the accelerator backend.
Move the object to the host backend.
Print object information.

detaileddescription.para: Info can print object information about any rocALUTION object. This information consists of object properties and backend data.

briefdescription.para: Perform a sanity check of the vector.

detaileddescription.para: Checks, if the vector contains valid data, i.e. if the values are not infinity and not NaN (not a number).

parameterdescription.para: if the vector is ok (empty vector is also ok).
if there is something wrong with the values.

briefdescription.para: Return the size of the vector.
Return the size of the local vector.
Return the size of the ghost vector.
Allocate a global vector with name and size.
Clear (free all data) the object.
Set the parallel manager of a global vector.
Set all values of the vector to 0.
Set all values of the vector to 1.
Set all values of the vector to given argument.

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned long long seed, ValueType a=static_cast< ValueType >(-1), ValueType b=static_cast< ValueType >(1))
memberdef.name: SetRandomUniform

briefdescription.para: Fill the vector with random values from interval [a,b].

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned long long seed, ValueType mean=static_cast< ValueType >(0), ValueType var=static_cast< ValueType >(1))
memberdef.name: SetRandomNormal

briefdescription.para: Fill the vector with random values from normal distribution.

Initialize the local part of a global vector with externally allocated data.
Get a pointer to the data from the local part of a global vector and free the global vector object.

detaileddescription.para: Read a vector from ASCII file.

parameterdescription.para: name of the file containing the ASCII data.

briefdescription.para: Write vector to ASCII file.

detaileddescription.para: Write a vector to ASCII file.

parameterdescription.para: name of the file to write the ASCII data to.

briefdescription.para: Read vector from binary file.

detaileddescription.para: Read a vector from binary file. For details on the format, see WriteFileBinary().

parameterdescription.para: name of the file containing the data.

briefdescription.para: Write vector to binary file.

detaileddescription.para: Write a vector to binary file.

simplesect.para: Vector values array is always stored in double precision (e.g. double or std::complex<double>).

parameterdescription.para: name of the file to write the data to.

briefdescription.para: Perform vector update of type this = this + alpha * x.
Perform vector update of type this = alpha * this + x.

memberdef.argsstring: (ValueType alpha, const GlobalVector< ValueType > &x, ValueType beta, const GlobalVector< ValueType > &y, ValueType gamma)
memberdef.name: ScaleAdd2

briefdescription.para: Perform vector update of type this = alpha * this + x * beta + y * gamma.

memberdef.argsstring: (ValueType alpha, const GlobalVector< ValueType > &x, ValueType beta)
memberdef.name: ScaleAddScale

briefdescription.para: Perform vector update of type this = alpha * this + x * beta.
Perform vector scaling this = alpha * this.
Compute dot (scalar) product, return this^T y.
Compute non-conjugate dot (scalar) product, return this^T y.
Compute $L_2$ norm of the vector, return = srqt(this^T this)
Reduce the vector.
Compute the sum of absolute values of the vector, return = sum(|this|)
Compute the absolute max of the vector, return = index(max(|this|))
Perform point-wise multiplication (element-wise) of this = this * x.
Perform point-wise multiplication (element-wise) of this = x * y.
Perform power operation to a vector.
Restriction operator based on restriction mapping vector.
Prolongation operator based on restriction mapping vector.
Return true if the object is on the host.
Return true if the object is on the accelerator.
Update ghost values asynchronously.
Update ghost values synchronously.
GlobalVector class.

detaileddescription.para: A GlobalVector is called global, because it can stay on a single or on multiple nodes in a network. For this type of communication, MPI is used.

parameterdescription.para: - can be int, float, double, std::complex<float> and std::complex<double>
